description: A collection of circles in an ovular formation with a small triangular formation above and to the left of it and a larger triangular formation above and to the right. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a long, thin, dark gray triangle on the upper left of the ovular part of the formation and a small red triangle on the upper right of the ovular formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
